text:
(1) Gerritsen Ave., north from Jamaica Bay. In the foreground, is the beginning of Marine Park on Jamaica Bay. June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A portion of view No. 1 and showing buildings, partially seen on the right. June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Gerritsen Ave., north from Jamaica Bay. In the foreground, is the beginning of Marine Park on Jamaica Bay. June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A portion of view No. 1 and showing buildings, partially seen on the right. June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

Gerritsen Avenue (left) northward from Marine Park at Plumb Beach Channel.

June 23, 1935

P. L. Sperr

Marine Park: Marine Park Canal in Marine Park showing a set of two views at different angles. Note the pretzel vendor in view No. 2.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park.

text:
Marine Park: Marine Park Canal in Marine Park showing a set of two views at different angles. Note the pretzel vendor in view No. 2.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park.

text:
Marine Park: A set of three views looking southeastward from Marine Park Beach at Gerritsen Creek and Plumb Beach Channel, towards Flatbush Ave. (seen in the background with cars thereon). This area will be filled leaving only a canal, the rest of it to be used for recreational purposes.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park.

text:
Marine Park: A set of three views looking southeastward from Marine Park Beach at Gerritsen Creek and Plumb Beach Channel, towards Flatbush Ave. (seen in the background with cars thereon). This area will be filled leaving only a canal, the rest of it to be used for recreational purposes.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park.

text:
Marine Park: A set of three views looking southeastward from Marine Park Beach at Gerritsen Creek and Plumb Beach Channel, towards Flatbush Ave. (seen in the background with cars thereon). This area will be filled leaving only a canal, the rest of it to be used for recreational purposes.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park.

text:
Marine Park: A view of Marine Park Beach near the Canal. June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - Marine Park Beach.

text:
Marine Park, showing boats at anchorage at Marine Park Beach. In the left background is the Administrative buildings of Floyd Bennett Field. The writer believes this view is south east and that the boats are anchored in Mill Creek.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - Marine Park Beach.

text:
Marine Park: A view of Marine Park Canal.
June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - Marine Park Canal.

text:
Marine Park: At Marine Park Canal, showing a refreshment truck catering to the wants of the bathers. This view is east.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - Marine Park Canal.

text:
Marine Park; as seen from foot of Gerritsen Ave. A panoramic set of two views.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - foot of Gerritsen Avenue.

text:
Marine Park; as seen from foot of Gerritsen Ave. A panoramic set of two views.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - foot of Gerritsen Avenue.

text:
Marine Park, west side of Gerritsen Creek, viewed eastward, showing Flatbush Ave. in the background. This is a set of 3 views taken from different angles.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west side - Gerritsen Creek, east.

text:
Marine Park, west side of Gerritsen Creek, viewed eastward, showing Flatbush Ave. in the background. This is a set of 3 views taken from different angles.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west side - Gerritsen Creek, east.

text:
Marine Park, west side of Gerritsen Creek, viewed eastward, showing Flatbush Ave. in the background. This is a set of 3 views taken from different angles.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west side - Gerritsen Creek, east.

text:
Marine Park: Gerritsen Creek, west bank, in Marine Park, viewed southeastward, towards Floyd Bennett Field.
June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - Gerritsen Creek - West Bank.

text:
Marine Park: A view of Gerritsen Creek, from Marine Park Beach at Plumb Beach Channel, viewed eastward to Flatbush Ave. At the left background are seen the Administrative buildings of Floyd Bennett Field.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Gerritson Creek.

text:
Marine Park, west bank of Gerritsen Creek (Marine Park Canal), south towards Gerritsen Inlet and Mill Creek, showing a set of 3 views, of the beach. In No. 3 the Administrative buildings of Floyd Bennett Field may be seen at the left background.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west - Gerritsen Creek - south - Gerritsen Inlet Mill Creek.

text:
Marine Park, west bank of Gerritsen Creek (Marine Park Canal), south towards Gerritsen Inlet and Mill Creek, showing a set of 3 views, of the beach. In No. 3 the Administrative buildings of Floyd Bennett Field may be seen at the left background.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west - Gerritsen Creek - south - Gerritsen Inlet Mill Creek.

text:
Marine Park, west bank of Gerritsen Creek (Marine Park Canal), south towards Gerritsen Inlet and Mill Creek, showing a set of 3 views, of the beach. In No. 3 the Administrative buildings of Floyd Bennett Field may be seen at the left background.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west - Gerritsen Creek - south - Gerritsen Inlet Mill Creek.

text:
Plumb Beach Channel, southward toward Flatbush Ave. (background cars thereon) across Gerritsen Inlet, showing a set of 3 views from slightly different angles. Most of this watered area will be filled and made a part of Marine Park.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Plumb Beach Channel - Brooklyn - Flatbush Avenue.

text:
Plumb Beach Channel, southward toward Flatbush Ave. (background cars thereon) across Gerritsen Inlet, showing a set of 3 views from slightly different angles. Most of this watered area will be filled and made a part of Marine Park.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Plumb Beach Channel - Brooklyn - Flatbush Avenue.

text:
Plumb Beach Channel, southward toward Flatbush Ave. (background cars thereon) across Gerritsen Inlet, showing a set of 3 views from slightly different angles. Most of this watered area will be filled and made a part of Marine Park.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Plumb Beach Channel - Brooklyn - Flatbush Avenue.
